    • Method Detail

      • createTicket

        public static Ticket createTicket(Ticket baseTicket)
        Creates a new ticket, using an existing ticket as a base configuration. The static DEFAULT constant can be used when no ticket is explicitly specified. A name for the ticket is automatically generated. This function always succeeds.
        Parameters:
        baseTicket - to use
        Returns:
        newly created ticket

      • createTicket

        public static Ticket createTicket(Ticket baseTicket,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new ticket, using an existing ticket as a base configuration. The static DEFAULT constant can be used when no ticket is explicitly specified.
        Parameters:
        baseTicket - to use
        name - for the new ticket
        Returns:
        newly created ticket, null if it could not be created (name already used)

      • getAll

        public static java.util.Collection<Ticket> getAll()
        Gets all tickets available on the server
        Returns:
        tickets

      • getTicket

        public static Ticket getTicket(java.lang.String ticketName)
        Looks up a ticket by name
        Parameters:
        ticketName - for the ticket to find
        Returns:
        ticket, null if not found

      • removeTicket

        public static boolean removeTicket(java.lang.String ticketName)
        Removes a ticket by name. Returns true if the ticket was removed.
        Parameters:
        ticketName - for the ticket to remove
        Returns:
        True if removed, False if a ticket by this name did not exist

      • renameTicket

        public static boolean renameTicket(java.lang.String oldTicketName,
                                   java.lang.String newTicketName)
        Changes the name of an existing ticket
        Parameters:
        oldTicketName - old name of the ticket
        newTicketName - new name of the ticket
        Returns:
        True if renaming was successful (ticket existed and new name could be used), False if not

        Returns:

        Sets the ticket a player is currently editing through commands

      • isTicketItem

        public static boolean isTicketItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Gets whether a given item is a ticket item. This will return true also when the ticket the item is referencing does not exist.
        Parameters:
        item - to check
        Returns:
        True if the item is a ticket item

      • getTicketFromItem

        public static Ticket getTicketFromItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Gets a ticket from a ticket item. Returns null if the item is not a ticket item, or if the item references a non-existing ticket.
        Parameters:
        item - to get the ticket for
        Returns:
        ticket for the item, null if item is not an existing ticket

      • getNumberOfUses

        public static int getNumberOfUses(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Gets the number of times a ticket has been used
        Parameters:
        item - to read from
        Returns:
        number of times the ticket has been used

      • isTicketExpired

        public static boolean isTicketExpired(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Checks whether a ticket item has expired either the number of uses, and/or by time.
        Parameters:
        item - to check
        Returns:
        True if the ticket item is expired

      • isTicketOwner

        public static boolean isTicketOwner(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Checks whether a ticket item can be used by a player. Returns false when the player is not the owner of the ticket. Returns true when he is, or when the ticket is not bound to a player.
        Parameters:
        player - to check
        item - to check
        Returns:
        True if the player owns the ticket item and can use it

      • handleTickets

        public static boolean handleTickets(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    TrainProperties trainProperties)
        Handles the ticket requirements for a train. If no tickets are set for the train, this function always return true. Otherwise, the player is checked for suitable tickets for the train. Informative messages will be displayed to inform of failure or success in using the tickets. When tickets run out of uses they are automatically removed from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        player - to handle
        trainProperties - for the train the player is trying to enter or use
        Returns:
        True when the player meets ticket requirements, False if not

        public static void markChanged()

        public static void load()

        public static void save(boolean autosave)
